title: Copula-Based Deep Survival Models for Dependent Censoring. (arXiv:2306.11912v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: A survival dataset describes a set of instances (e.g. patients) and provides, for each, either the time until an event (e.g. death), or the censoring time (e.g. when lost to follow-up - which is a lower bound on the time until the event). We consider the challenge of survival prediction: learning, from such data, a predictive model that can produce an individual survival distribution for a novel instance. Many contemporary methods of survival prediction implicitly assume that the event and censoring distributions are independent conditional on the instance's covariates - a strong assumption that is difficult to verify (as we observe only one outcome for each instance) and which can induce significant bias when it does not hold. This paper presents a parametric model of survival that extends modern non-linear survival analysis by relaxing the assumption of conditional independence. translated_title: 基于Copula的依赖截尾深度生存模型
translated_abstract: 生存数据集描述了一组实例（例如患者），并为每个实例提供了事件发生的时间（例如死亡）或截尾时间（例如失去随访的时间 - 这是事件发生时间的下限）。本文提出了一种基于Copula的参数化生存模型，通过放宽条件独立性的假设，扩展现代非线性生存分析，从而显著改进了对生存分布的估计。
tldr: 论文提出了一种基于Copula的参数化生存模型，通过放宽条件独立性的假设，扩展现代非线性生存分析，从而显著改进了对生存分布的估计。
en_tdlr: The paper presents a parametric model of survival based on Copula, which extends modern non-linear survival analysis by relaxing the assumption of conditional independence and significantly improves the estimation of survival distribution.
